page.title: 05HOME LIFE IN FORFAR
page.content: {Food.}The Forfar{Bridie}may not be as well known as an Arbroath smokie but in Forfar it's the best thing since sliced bread.They're loved all through the town and round Angus.The exact formula is a secret in Forfar, but many butchers and bakers make their own bridies.{Recipe}The bridie consists of a pastry covering with chopped up beef and herbs filling to make a mild hot taste. Nearly all the people in Forfar have tasted a bridie and for the folk who haven't, they are missing out the best of Forfar. People have their own opinion as to who makes the best bridies.Unlike the Arbroath smokies, we in Forfar do not send our bridies to other cities or towns in Britain unless specially asked.The bridie is similar in looks to the Cornish pasty, but its taste is nothing like our Forfar bridie.
